description_txt: stated on March 16, 2018 in remarks on HBO's "Real Time with Bill Maher":
quote_txt: "Texas is one of the most gerrymandered states in the union."

description_txt: stated on July 30, 2018 in in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: Says Bill Nelson "doesn’t pay payroll taxes for his employees. He doesn’t even provide them with health benefits. It’s stealing money from Medicare and Social Security."

description_txt: stated on July 18, 2018 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Says Texas charter schools "get 100% state $/pupil funding while district schools (95% students) get about 1/3 funding from state w/ rest coming from local prop taxes (which is why those taxes are so high). Districts getting less b/c scarce $ going to charters."

description_txt: stated on August 18, 2018 in an interview with Hearst News:
quote_txt: Says Democratic challenger Gina Ortiz Jones has raised "more money from Massachusetts than" from Texas.

description_txt: stated on August 3, 2018 in in a livestreamed interview:
quote_txt: "The teachers in (charter) schools don't even have to be certified."

description_txt: stated on August 14, 2018 in a blog post:
quote_txt: "VIDEO Kevin Bacon Saying ‘We Are Blessed To Have Donald Trump As Our President’"

description_txt: stated on August 14, 2018 in a White House press briefing:
quote_txt: "President Trump in his first year and a half has already tripled what President Obama did (for African-American employment) in eight years."

description_txt: stated on August 8, 2018 in a speech to farmers:
quote_txt: "Hospitals are closing in rural America because they don't have access to high-speed internet."

description_txt: stated on August 14, 2018 in a blog:
quote_txt: A proposed constitutional amendment "will pave the way for making abortion illegal under North Carolina’s constitution."

description_txt: stated on July 12, 2018 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: Says Leah Vukmir "claimed the open records law didn't apply to her, got sued, lost and cost taxpayers $15,000 in legal fees."

description_txt: stated on June 11, 2018 in campaign website:
quote_txt: Says she is "the only candidate for Senate who refuses to cut Medicare and Social Security or raise the retirement age."

description_txt: stated on July 24, 2018 in a podcast interview:
quote_txt: China has "not acted so well with our elections. They’ve tampered with our elections quite a bit."

description_txt: stated on August 13, 2018 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Says Ohio Gov. John Kasich is "very unpopular."

description_txt: stated on August 7, 2018 in a speech:
quote_txt: "I am the only (state attorney general) in America fighting to hold the big tech companies accountable for their behavior."

description_txt: stated on August 5, 2018 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Says Rick Scott "cut $700 million from water management."

description_txt: stated on July 18, 2018 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Says Richard Cordray "secretly collected hundreds of millions of credit card accounts and mortgages. Worse, Cordray failed to protect our information. It was hacked over 200 times."

description_txt: stated on August 10, 2018 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "Most of that money (made by the NFL) goes to the players."

description_txt: stated on August 8, 2018 in a press release:
quote_txt: Says "43 of Joe’s legislative proposals have become law, including 21 since President Trump took office."

description_txt: stated on July 1, 2018 in in a Facebook ad:
quote_txt: Says Sean Casten supports "doubling premiums" and "cutting current health care plans."

description_txt: stated on August 1, 2018 in a radio ad:
quote_txt: Claims that Democratic candidate for governor Matt Flynn "told one child predator to ‘wait and see,’ when he should have turned him in to authorities."

description_txt: stated on June 1, 2018 in an interview:
quote_txt: "Wisconsin's still one of the highest-taxed states in the country."

description_txt: stated on August 8, 2018 in a candidates forum:
quote_txt: Says he was "not part of transferring" any priests accused of sexual abuse.

description_txt: stated on August 7, 2018 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "A number of Democrats running for governor want to cut the prison population by 50%" and "that would require the release of thousands of violent felons."

description_txt: stated on August 7, 2018 in a blog post:
quote_txt: "LeBron’s ‘I Promise School’ To Cost Taxpayers Millions Of Dollars Every Year"

description_txt: stated on August 3, 2018 in on candidate's website:
quote_txt: Says Matt Rosendale "consistently supported land use rules that would help developers like him and hurt farmers in Montana."

description_txt: stated on July 17, 2018 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "Congressman DeSantis voted to cut Social Security and Medicare" and "voted to increase the retirement age."

description_txt: stated on July 26, 2018 in a press release:
quote_txt: "America’s hard-working agricultural producers … have taken a disproportionate hit when it comes to illegal retaliatory tariffs."

description_txt: stated on August 1, 2018 in a news release:
quote_txt: Says Mahlon Mitchell "received a massive raise on the backs of hard-working firefighters and turned the union into his own personal political slush fund."

description_txt: stated on July 31, 2018 in an interview:
quote_txt: "I have always been there with" Donald Trump.

description_txt: stated on August 1, 2018 in an online video:
quote_txt: Says Leah Vukmir said: "I’m not endorsing Donald Trump."
